feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 16 at 10:44AM AKST until December 16 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow with low visibility occuring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches are expected. Visibility will be one quarter mile or less at times.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 5:33AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Stormy Week Ahead... A weather system moving through the Bering Sea will reach the Yukon Delta Friday afternoon. Snowfall with this system will move north and east Friday evening into Saturday and will bring 3-8 inches of snow south of the Bering Strait Friday afternoon into Saturday morning, with 1-4 inches north of the Bering Strait
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 16 at 2:57AM AKST until December 16 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Cold wind chills as low as 60 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 2:17AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snowfall Possible Early Next Week... Heavy snowfall is possible Sunday night into Tuesday across the Central and Eastern Interior, including Fairbanks. This weather system also has the potential to bring gusty winds to the area, along with freezing rain. There is still a lot of uncertainty with the exact details of this

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 3:47PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW POSSIBLE FRIDAY FOR SOUTHERN PANHANDLE... A system could bring accumulating snow to the Southern Panhandle and parts of the outer coastal areas, from Port Alexander south, on Friday. Some scenarios offer the possibility of 3-5 inches of snowfall accumulation during this time. However, an anticipated southerly wind push could bring in warmer air and result in a

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 5:17PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Locally Dense Fog this Evening... Area of fog are expected this evening, and the fog may locally be dense in spots. Those traveling should be alert for sudden reductions in visibility. Slow down, use low beam headlights and allow plenty of time to reach your destination. The visibility will improve later tonight as a cold front crosses the region.

entry.summary: ...Heavy rains possible late Friday and Friday night... A frontal boundary will lift north on Friday and linger across our region into Friday night. entry.summary: ...COLD WEATHER WILL CAUSE ICE FORMATION ON THE MISSOURI RIVER... entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves up to 10 feet. * WHERE...North, east and southeast-facing beaches of Puerto Rico, all of Vieques, Culebra and the U.S. Virgin Islands.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 1:47PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: Strong winds with gusts 45 to 55 MPH will be possible along Interstate 25 near Bordeaux between Chugwater and Wheatland this afternoon. Use extra caution in this area if you have a light weight or high profile vehicle.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 1:37PM MST until December 17 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT STARTING NOW UNTIL 8 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches expected, with locally higher amounts possible. * WHERE...Snowy and Sierra Madre mountain ranges. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Friday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 16 at 12:20PM MST until December 17 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains, Yellowstone National Park and Salt River and Wyoming Ranges.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 7:32AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Light Snow Today into Friday Morning... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Snow. Accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. * WHERE...The Jackson and Star Valleys. * WHEN...This morning through Friday morning.
